titles.title: National Credit Union Administration Budget Transparency Act
National Credit Union Administration Budget Transparency Act
To require the National Credit Union Administration to hold public hearings and receive comments from the public on its budget, and for other purposes.
National Credit Union Administration Budget Transparency Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 40 - 16.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 114-868.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 678.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)
National Credit Union Administration Budget Transparency Act
(Sec. 2) This bill amends the Federal Credit Union Act to require the National Credit Union Administration Board, before the annual submission of its required detailed business-type budget, to: (1) print a draft of the budget in the Federal Register, (2) hold a public hearing to receive comments from the public on the draft, and (3) include in the required integral set of accounts statements in which the budget will address any of such comments.
